quizzes.question: What do we call the function used for concatenation?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The CONCAT Function[/h1]

The [b]CONCAT [/b]function is used to concatenate two or more text values and returns the concatenating string.

Let's concatenate the [i]FirstName [/i]with the [i]City[/i], separating them with a [i]comma[/i]:[code format="sql"]SELECT [b]CONCAT[/b](FirstName, ', ' , City) FROM customers;[/code]
The output result is: [img id="2818" width="100%"]

quizzes.question: Type in the keyword used to create custom columns.
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The AS Keyword[/h1]

A concatenation results in a new column. The default column name will be the CONCAT function.
You can assign a custom name to the resulting column using the [b]AS [/b]keyword: [code format="sql"]SELECT CONCAT(FirstName,', ', City) [b]AS [/b]new_column 
FROM customers;[/code]
And when you run the query, the column name appears to be changed. [img id="2819" width="100%"]

[h1]Arithmetic Operators[/h1]

Arithmetic operators perform arithmetical operations on numeric operands. The Arithmetic operators include addition (+), subtraction (-), multiplication (*) and division (/). 

The following [b]employees [/b]table shows employee names and salaries: [img id="2820" width="100%"]
The example below adds 500 to each employee's salary and selects the result: [code format="sql"]SELECT ID, FirstName, LastName, [b]Salary+500 AS Salary
[/b]FROM employees;[/code]
[b]Result[/b]: [img id="2821" width="100%"]
